intro: Torilis syriaca, commonly known as Syrian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, and the plant produces small, oblong seeds that are dispersed by wind. Torilis syriaca is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
